page.title: 10DANKEITH FARM _ DUNDONALD
page.content: It is 5.30am in the morning and my dad is going to our grandparents' farm to do the milking which takes about 2 hours. At about 10 o'clock we all do our chores.John lets out his bantams and collects the eggs,Anne feeds the kittens and I put out the goat and I give her water and feed her. After dinner my dad goes out. He fixes the fences and checks that the cattle are all in their correct fields.At 4 o'clock once again my dad goes to do the milking. At night John shuts in the bantams to protect them from the fox and Anne feeds the kittens and I put in the goat safely till the morning. Life on a farm can be very hectic, especially during the harvest, but it is always good fun!
